sentence.Network_en: Watching television had a numbing effect on his mind.

sentence.Network_cn: 这是一种令人麻木的工作, 需要有耐心和忘我精神.

entry.def: If a part of your body is numb, you cannot feel anything there.

example.ex: He could feel his fingers growing numb at their tips...
example.tran: 他能感到指尖正在变得麻木。

example.ex: My legs felt numb and my toes ached.

entry.tran: (因震惊、害怕、悲痛等)失态的，木然的
entry.def: If you are numb with shock, fear, or grief, you are so shocked, frightened, or upset that you cannot think clearly or feel any emotion.

example.ex: The mother, numb with grief, has trouble speaking...
example.tran: 那位母亲因过于悲痛而说不出话来。

example.ex: I was so shocked I went numb.

entry.def: If an event or experience numbs you, you can no longer think clearly or feel any emotion.

example.ex: For a while the shock of Philippe's letter numbed her...
example.tran: 菲利普来信的打击让她愣了好一会儿。

example.ex: The horror of my experience has numbed my senses.
example.tran: 我经历的那种恐怖已使我感觉迟钝。

entry.tran: (因天气、药品或重击)使(身体某部位)麻木，使失去知觉
entry.def: If cold weather, a drug, or a blow numbs a part of your body, you can no longer feel anything in it.

example.tran: 严寒冻得我的手指都没有知觉了。

example.ex: An injection of local anaesthetic is usually given first to numb the area...
example.tran: 通常先注射局部麻醉药，使该部位失去知觉。
